definition: ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces

sentences.english: Yesterday, the City Federation of Trade Unions held in sympathy with the Urban Management Committee of the sanitation workers activities.
sentences.chinese: 昨日，市总工会与市城管委举行慰问环卫工人活动。

sentences.english: Donot forget our sanitation workers, too.
sentences.chinese: 说到辛苦，还有咱环卫工人。

sentences.english: He had gone there to lead protests in support of black sanitation workers.
sentences.chinese: 他已经有领导支持黑环卫工人的抗议。

sentences.english: It also raised the supernumerary City sanitation workers the basic wage.
sentences.chinese: 福州市还提高了编外环卫工人的基本工资。

sentences.english: Methods The medical examination to the dust men was carried out.
sentences.chinese: 方法对环卫工人进行体格检查，结果进行统计学分析。

sentences.english: The paper is to report that polluted levels of harmful material in operation environment for environmental health workers.
sentences.chinese: 本文报导了环卫工人作业环境中有害物的污染水平。

sentences.english: We will see where the city workers sort all of our garbage for recycling.
sentences.chinese: 我们将看到环卫工人把垃圾分类再利用的场所。
